hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When negative liquidity news (e.g., 'liquidity crash' headlines) causes a sharp 1-hour BTC price drop >3% on elevated volume (>150% of 20-day avg), price will mean-revert >50% of the drop within the next 6 hours as panic selling exhausts and opportunistic buyers fill the gap.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent 'liquidity crash' narratives create exaggerated fear. In neutral/bull regimes, institutional and algorithmic buyers systematically exploit these overreactions. The 4-hour RSI <25 ensures oversold conditions, while volume confirmation separates real selling from noise.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes >3% below previous close
Negative liquidity news confirmed within past 2 hours
Regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (not STRESS)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 1-hour drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new low below entry candle by 1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 55% of signals achieve 50% retracement within 6 hours over 50 occurrences
